# keycard_application_workload_identity (Data Source)

Reads a workload identity credential for a Keycard application. This allows you to reference existing workload identity credentials that authenticate using tokens from external identity providers (Kubernetes, GitHub Actions, AWS EKS, etc.).

## Example Usage

```terraform
# Look up an existing workload identity by zone_id and id
# Useful for referencing workload identities credentials created outside Terraform
data "keycard_application_workload_identity" "okta_mcp" {
  zone_id = keycard_zone.production.id
  id      = var.keycard_workload_identity_id
}

# Use the data source to verify configuration
output "mcp_service_account_subject" {
  value       = data.keycard_application_workload_identity.okta_mcp.subject
  description = "Kubernetes service account subject for Okta MCP server"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `id` (String) Unique identifier of the workload identity credential.
- `zone_id` (String) The zone this credential belongs to.

### Read-Only

- `application_id` (String) The application this credential belongs to.
- `provider_id` (String) The provider that validates tokens for this credential.
- `subject` (String) The subject claim (sub) that must match in the bearer token. Empty when any token from the provider is accepted. Format depends on the token issuer:
  - Kubernetes: `system:serviceaccount:<namespace>:<service-account-name>`
  - GitHub Actions: `repo:<org>/<repo>:ref:refs/heads/<branch>`
  - AWS EKS: `system:serviceaccount:<namespace>:<service-account-name>`
